channel.title: Amerikaner Podcast RSS
channel.description: This is the Amerikaner master list

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: The Midwest Network's Oktoberfest (Explicit)
item.description:
Gordon and Alex (of The Smoke Pit) recorded a series of live interviews at the Midwest Network's inaugural event, and the local organizer's 7th annual Oktoberfest. We have a variety of voices, from the event organizers, long-distance visitors, wives, mothers, fathers, activists, content producers, all joined together in a celebration of White Pride and White Identity.

Please note that due to the variety of guests (and in some cases a few too many Oktoberfest brews), the usual clean-language policy is not in effect - listener discretion is advised.

If you would like to get involved in the Midwest Network, please check out the write-up Gordon did on them - you'll be glad you did.

Gordon is going to be on the road for the next couple of months! If you would like him to visit you, contact him at dakotafash@protonmail.com or DM him on Telegram @GordonKahl - the PO Box, in the meantime, is inoperable.

This episode was released early to our paid subscribers, and later for free. If you would like this early access, as well as other exclusive content, please visit amerikaner.org/donate for online payment options, including cryptocurrency wallets.

Achtung! Amerikaner is proud to be hosted on Amerikaner.org and ExodusAmericanus.com

item.title: The Final Storm is Here: TFS 140: The Deaf Mexican Show
item.description: The gang is all here as they do their final rounds on Snow White/Dirt Brown, and the pros and cons of it being shelved, before we move on to the newest Star Wars failure and how Disney's stock is at an all time low, debunking the meme that it is all for money.

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: Ethnogenesis and Empire
item.description:
Gordon and Magnus have a discussion about the 2018 New York Times article "The Maps That Show That City vs. Country Is Not Our Political Fault Line" by Collin Woodard, which is, itself, discussing Woodard's book "American Nations: A History of the Eleven Rival Regional Cultures of North America.” The two discuss how accurate the distinctions are, and why these distinctions matter, especially in regards to forming a cohesive "Amerikaner" identity.

This episode was released early for our supporters, and later for free. If you would like this early access, as well as other exclusive content, please visit Amerikaner.org/donate for online payment options and cryptocurrency wallets.

Achtung! Amerikaner is proudly found at Amerikaner.org and ExodusAmericanus.com

Relevant Links

  • The Original Article: https://archive.is/rDYp6
  • US Census Regions and Divisions: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f1/Census_Regions_and_Division_of_the_United_States.svg
  • Bureau of Economic Analysis Regions: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/b/b7/BEA_regions.png
  • Reddit Map: https://www.reddit.com/r/MapPorn/comments/lk423y/the_most_accurate_cultural_map_of_the_us_that_ive/

item.title: The Gamer Word: The Gamer Word Episode 38- Black Texan Musicals
item.description: While Ruckus is on hiatus tracking down a waifu that claims to be descended from Genghis Kahn, Rolo and Bobby have a hearty discussion about how to survive in Texas. Helpful tips include keeping your chainsaw revved and ready as you dodge sheboon uber drivers and keep your bros from simping for obese ethots.

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: The Stories We Tell Ourselves (Featuring Magnus)
item.description:
Gordon and Magnus have a (sometimes rambling, but always interesting) discussion about several narratives in the "hot take" ecosystem, and what they might mean for the future of America, and especially for Amerikaners. They start with the recent viral "Trump Mugshot," move on to happenings on "The Website Formerly Known as Twitter" and finish off with some fun banter related to the shenanigans of the Paiute Tribal Police.

This episode was released early for our generous supporters - if you would like this early access, as well as other exclusive content, please visit Amerikaner.org/Donate where you will find online payment options, including cryptocurrency wallets.

Achtung! Amerikaner is proudly found on Amerikaner.org and ExodusAmericanus.com

item.description: Come join the men as they discuss the current state of the video game industry: from monitoring you for wrong think, making moves to push their "history" lessons onto children, and testing the waters on yet even more intrusive "security measures"; to the state of remakes and how the only things that seem to be real are Black Ninjas and breast reduction for all the hot chicks Gamers have come to enjoy.

After the autopsy is complete we move onto more apeposting, followed by a search for more young attractive actresses. We found them, and they are active, but Hollywood doesn't want to showcase them.

item.title: The Godcast: The Godcast, Episode 256: The Last 30 Minutes of a Very Dumb Argument
item.description:
In this episode, SuperLutheran and Myles take a look at a profoundly dumb argument against the Faith called "The Last 30 Minutes of Christianity." It's not only a very bad argument, but doesn't even address any of the core claims of Christianity to begin with. 

Are Jews the chosen people of God? No: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pzHB5Caglgo

Age of Ruin: From the Ashes: https://poa.st/@Godcast/posts/ALVRT05jJfK3me3PtY

The first of what I hope to be many entries in a science fiction universe both by and for /ourguys/.

item.title: The Gamer Word: The Gamer Word Episode 36- Goblin Rockstar
item.description: The men come together to discuss the war on Gamers and the slimy goblinoids that are ruining everything: From the absolute travesty of turning hot busty White women into snarling monkeys (with bonus discussion on when you could have an entertainment product whose whole point was to showcase a White bombshell) to how one of the biggest names in the video game industry is putting out shit in a box and they think Gamers will buy it because it has their label on it.

The Final Storm is Here: TFS 137: Common Core Casting
item.description: The gang is back in action to bring you a much needed take down on Rachel Zegler, the Anti White brown that is playing White cultural icon, Snow White, despite her obvious contempt for Whites and their culture. After that we dive into the incestuous, and potentially money laundering operation, relationship between Hollywood studios and Hollywood journalism. Before we end, we pitch a movie, in a new segment that may or may not become a regular thing.

item.title: The Final Storm is Here: TFS 136: Call Me back and Tell Me The Opposite
item.description: The gang returns to discuss the real 2 word legacy of Matthew Broderick to counter what he pretends it is. Afterwards, they go into a little bit of lies from Hollywood's master of blood libel storytelling, Steven Spielberg. We run down a little bit of the AFI top 100, the upcoming disaster, El Blue Beetleo, and how banking on hlatinos and an openly anti White marketing campaign is the next step in the downfall of Hollywood. Lastly, more credence is added to SteveDave's theory that the strikes were fake.

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: Achtung! International - The Australian Natives Association
item.description:
Gordon interviews Grant, of the Australian Natives' Association, a brotherhood of Australian men united by their national identity. Through community efforts and self improvement they work for the benefit of their members and their families. Gordon and Grant discuss the interesting similarities, as well as the differences, in ethnic and racial organizing in the United States and down under.

For more information on the Australian Natives Association, visit their website http://ausnatives.org/ or follow them on telegram https://t.me/AusNativesAssociation

This episode was released early to paid subscribers. If you would like this early access, as well as other exclusive content, please visit amerikaner.org/donate for online payment options.

Achtung! Amerikaner is proudly hosted on Amerikaner.org and ExodusAmericanus.com

item.description: The men come together to discuss the state of the gaming industry as a whole and whether or not turning a butch lesbo squatamalen into a pretty Italian will be enough to save a company that has showed time an again they do not care about their customers and are on board with all the anti-Gamer things being done.

item.title: Exodus Americanus: Exo 372
The Godcast: The Godcast, Episode 255: Blood Libel
item.description:
In this episode, SuperLutheran and Myles take a brief look at the historical basis of jewish "blood libel," the accusation that jews participated in the kidnapping and ritual murder of Christian children during the middle ages. We answer your emails after the break.

Are Jews the chosen people of God? No: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pzHB5Caglgo

Age of Ruin: From the Ashes: https://poa.st/@Godcast/posts/ALVRT05jJfK3me3PtY

The first of what I hope to be many entries in a science fiction universe both by and for /ourguys/.

Things we talked about during the show:

Blood Libel: https://infogalactic.com/info/Blood_libel

William of Norwich: https://infogalactic.com/info/William_of_Norwich

Simon of Trent: https://infogalactic.com/info/Simon_of_Trent

Pope at the time of Simon of Trent, Pope Sixtus IV: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Sixtus_IV

Jews and Power in the Middle Ages: https://www.theoccidentalobserver.net/2022/12/09/review-jews-and-crime-in-medieval-europe/

https://www.theoccidentalobserver.net/2013/01/21/review-anthony-julius-trials-of-the-diaspora-part-2-medieval-english-anti-semitism/

The JQ in Imperial Russia: https://www.theoccidentalobserver.net/2012/05/08/revisiting-the-19th-century-russian-pogroms-part-1-russias-jewish-question/

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: Midwest News Roundup July 2023
item.description:
Gordon and Grug are back to wow you with their hot takes on a variety of news stories from across the midwest (and one Canadian story for good measure). From getting arrested by foreigners in Illinois to bad-optics guys scaring pedophiles in Wisconsin, we have all the news you need right here!

This episode was released early to our paid subscribers. For this and other special content, please visit Amerikaner.org/donate

Gordon will soon be going on the road - if you would like him to visit you, or have an interesting place you think he should check out, contact him at dakotafash@protonmail.com or message him on telegram, https://t.me/GordonKahl

Achtung! Amerikaner is proud to be hosted on Amerikaner.org and ExodusAmericanus.com

Stories Covered This Episode

Illinois: Gov JB Pritzker Signs Bill Allowing Foreigners To Become Police Officers
https://www.foxnews.com/media/illinois-gov-pritzker-allows-non-us-citizens-become-police-officers-new-law-fundamentally-bad-idea

Indiana: Indiana Brings Into Effect Near-Total Abortion Ban
https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2023/08/01/1191156197/after-yearlong-fight-a-near-total-abortion-ban-is-going-into-effect-in-indiana

Iowa: Trump Is Shaping Up To Be The Republican Nominee, To The Shock Of Only Libtards
https://apnews.com/article/trump-desantis-iowa-republicans-presidential-campaign-5ac4475b203c6d833729b15c31482273

Kansas: Kansas wheat harvest worst in over 50 years
https://www.ksnt.com/news/local-news/kansas-wheat-harvest-smallest-in-over-50-years/

Michigan: Former AG candidate DePerno, state rep Rendon charged with violating Michigan election law
https://www.freep.com/story/news/politics/2023/08/01/matt-deperno-daire-rendon-gop-candidates-charged-election-law/70507504007/

Minnesota: Derek Chauvin to appeal to the US Supreme Court after Minnesota’s high court declines to review his state murder conviction
https://www.cnn.com/2023/07/19/us/derek-chauvin-minnesota-supreme-court-appeal-denial/index.html

Missouri: Kansas City man becomes 31st Missouri resident to be charged in January 6 Capitol breach
https://www.kmbc.com/article/kansas-city-missouri-man-charged-in-capitol-breach/44705264

Nebraska: Nebraska parent involvement hearing devolves into talk of slavery, CRT, porn and Bill Gates
https://nebraskaexaminer.com/2023/07/31/nebraska-parent-involvement-hearing-devolves-into-talk-of-slavery-crt-porn-and-bill-gates/

North Dakota: Literally 1984 - Seatbelts Now Mandatory In North Dakota
https://www.kxnet.com/news/top-stories/buckle-up-today-seat-belt-use-is-mandatory-in-north-dakota/

Ohio: 'Am I wrong?': Ohio officer who released police dog on Black man defends himself on bodycam video
https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/body-cam-video-shows-ohio-officer-sicced-police-dog-black-man-defendin-rcna97469

South Dakota: South Dakota non-profit receives funding to develop statewide public transit plan for Native American Reservations
https://www.blackhillsfox.com/2023/08/01/south-dakota-non-profit-receives-funding-develop-statewide-public-transit-plan-native-american-reservations/

Wisconsin: Nazis protest a Wisconsin Pride event, shouting homophobic slurs
https://www.nbcnews.com/nbc-out/out-news/nazis-protest-wisconsin-pride-event-shouting-homophobic-slurs-rcna97529

Honorary Mention: Toronto Mayor Olivia Chow asks Toronto residents to offer rental units for refugees as shelter spaces fill up
https://www.theglobeandmail.com/amp/canada/article-olivia-chow-asks-toronto-residents-to-open-homes-to-refugees/

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: The Patriot Front Show Trial
item.description:
Gordon, Grug, Magnus, and Presby discuss the outcome of the recent trial for five brave members of Patriot Front in Couer d'Alene Idaho - the panel goes over the case from where it started to where it is now, as well as the response from the broader right wing and conservative sphere.

This episode was released early to paid subscribers. If you would like this early access, or other exclusive content, please visit Amerikaner.org/donate where you will find online payment options.

Gordon will soon be travelling and producing content on the road - as such, the PO Box will no longer be available. More information on this to come.

item.title: The Gamer Word: The Gamer Word Episode 33- They know what you want (they just wanna ruin it for you)
item.description: Ruckus, Rolo, and Bobby come together to discuss the lamentable fact that, while big companies will spend a bunch of money on games, the people who actually make the games are effectively taking pay cuts to work on them, as opposed to similar jobs in the tech field. Come listen and get educated about how all that goblin money is used to ruin every new game for you, but appeal to the unnatural dysgenic masses they want to replace you with.

Tonight at 8pm Central, Gordon and Grug were both on vacation last week/weekend and as such have no real show prep - so instead we're going to talk about whatever comes to mind, or whatever anyone asks us or brings up on the livestream. We'll take questions from the chat and let people Kahll in (just DM Gordon on Telegram). Hope to see you all there!

item.description:
Gordon and Magnus read through a recent article from The Asylum entitled "A National Divorce From Reality," itself a response to an Asylum piece by Michael Anton, former Trump staffer, that was a dialogue between a liberal and a conservative about a "national divorce." The article goes through all of the problems with this strategy, while Gordon and Magnus go through their problems with the article itself.

https://asylummagazine.ca/MALCOLM-OR-ON-SEPARATION

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: The Midwest Network
item.description:
Recently, I shared a post on the official Telegram channel for Amerikaner.org about a new coalition called The Midwest Network. In the interest of spreading awareness about this worthy cause, I have decided to share some of their most recent posts here in article format.

Full Disclosure: I am, in fact, involved with The Midwest Network - I am not its director, or otherwise "in charge," but I and a few others have been working on the project for a couple of months, as well as with our partner network, The Western Confederation (covering the Mountain West region) and I feel that it is a worthwhile endeavor and trust everyone involved, and feel confident in saying that you can trust them as well.

For the full write-up, visit https://amerikaner.org/the-midwest-network/

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: Carbon Capture Deep Dive
item.description:
Join Gordon, Magnus, and Huey as they pull back the curtain on the catabolic sustainability scam that's taking over rural Iowa. Like any great Western we've got it all: crooked lawmen, grasping corporate interests forcing farmers off their land, and behind it all a corrupt and powerful amalgamation of political and corporate interests eager to suck the lifeblood of the Midwest in the name of 'Green' energy.

This episode was recorded on June 17th,  and released on the 18th for paid subscribers - it is being released for free now. If you would like this sort of early access, as well as other exclusive content, please visit Amerikaner.org/Donate where you will find online payment options, as well as our PO Box.

item.title: Pressure Suit Podcast: This Time The Multiverse: Glen Cook’s The Black Company
item.description:
On this episode of This Time The MultiVerse, Gordon and Magnus the brooding and atmospheric Dark Fantasy series by Glen Cook. Join The Black Company, last of the Free Companies of Khatovar, a warrior brotherhood centuries old, as they take on their most hazardous commission yet: service to a legendary sorceress straight from the nightmares of the old world. Croaker, combat medic by day and Chronicler by night, finds himself and the rest of his grim band of brothers embroiled in intrigue, horror, and bloodshed when they take the bread and salt of The Lady, Empress of the North, a sorceress thought long dead and buried, and who’s triumphant return marks the end of the age. Fighting for the Powers of Darkness isn’t easy, but the pay is good and the chow is hot and regular—and it takes more than ancient wizards, undead monsters, or world-ending Final Battles to wipe out The Black Company!

Dripping with atmosphere and suspense, Cook’s simple, poetic style, engaging characters, and stark, down-to-earth portrayal of war makes this epic dark fantasy series a rewarding and entertaining read, with a truly unique treatment of military and dark fantasy themes that will satisfy both hardcore fantasy fans and casual readers of genre fiction.
item.dc:creator: Magnus Williams

item.title: Pressure Suit Podcast: This Time The Multiverse: Lois McMaster Bujold’s Curse of Chalion
item.description:
On this episode of This Time The MultiVerse, Gordon and Magnus explore the mysterious and wonderful high fantasy of Lois McMaster Bujold’s Realm of the FIve Gods series! Inspired by 15-century Spain, Bujold’s fantasy world employs a unique conceit–one where the gods are real, and faith, not magic, is the tool by which evil is vanquished.

Once a Courier, Courtier, Castle-warder and Captain, Lupe dy Cazaril is a crippled ex-soldier, making his slow and painful way home after being betrayed and sold as a galley slave. Seeking only a quiet, humble life, Cazaril finds himself entangled in a web of political intrigue, mystery, and miracle when he is promoted to Secretary-Tutor to the Royess Eselle, the beautiful, fiery sister of the heir to Chalion’s throne. Beset by powerful enemies at home and abroad, Cazaril must come face-to-face with Divinity, Demons, and damnation to shatter the lingering curse that threatens to plunge Iselle and all of Chalion into darkness.

Equal parts mystery, political intrigue, and high fantasy story, Chalion‘s world unfolds through the eyes of Cazaril, world-weary but unbroken, as he struggles to find the faith to carry out the gods’ will. Alternately tender-hearted, terrifying, and bitingly witty, Bujold weaves a captivating, character-driven drama suffused with a sober and sensible treatment of theology, in the style of Tolkien and Lewis. Winner of the Hugo, Nebula and Locus awards for Best Novel, The Curse of Chalion‘s pathos, poignancy, and rock-solid pacing makes it a wonderful choice for fans of SF, Fantasy, or any who loves a good read.
item.dc:creator: Magnus Williams

item.title: Pressure Suit Podcast: This Time The Multiverse: Edgar Rice Burrough’s A Princess of Mars
item.description:
Kaor! On this episode of This Time The MultiVerse, Gordon and Magnus roam the desolate desert sea bottoms, mysterious canals, and majestic dead cities of Barsoom, in Edgar Rice Burrough’s Planetary Fiction classic, A Princess of Mars. Inspiring generations of readers, writers, scientists, and explorers, the Barsoom series remains a favorite among young and old alike for its swashbuckling swordfights, death-defying escapades, dastardly villains, and gallant heroism. Strap on your sword, adjust your metal, and prepare for the adventure of a lifetime in one of the most openly moralizing, pro-White stories every put to pulp!

When gentleman adventurer John Carter finds himself in possession of a half-million dollars (Confederate) and a Captain’s commission in the cavalry of a nation that no longer exists, he heads west in search of gold and glory. But after falling asleep in a mysterious cave in the Arizona desert, he wakes up on the planet Mars. There he meets the fifteen foot tall, four armed, green men of mars, with horse-like dragons, and watchdogs like oversized frogs with ten legs. His adventures continue as he battles great white apes and vampiric plant men, defeats the Goddess of Death, battles hordes of black pirates and red warriors, and braves the frozen wastes of Polar Mars. In all things Captain John Carter perseveres, owing to the fighting blood of his Virginia sires, the courage and chivalry of a gentleman, and the love of the fair and lovely Deja Thoris, Princess of Helium, for whom he defies space, time, and even Death.

Burrough’s classic tale of high adventure and planetary romance takes the reader on a journey from the desolate sea-bottom wastes, where the hordes of Green Men roam, to the glittering Red Martian cities of Helium and Zodanga, to beyond the mysterious river Iss and the hidden valley Dor, on to the lost sea of Khorus and the deepest mysteries of the dying, noble, savage world of Barsoom!
item.dc:creator: Magnus Williams

item.title: Pressure Suit Podcast: This Time The MultiVerse: Larry Niven’s Ringworld
item.description:
On this episode of This Time The MultiVerse, Gordon and Magnus discuss Larry Niven’s Ringworld, a seminal novel of Science Fiction that introduced the Niven Ring, an artifact of astronomical size, a single band of material a million miles wide, and 584 million in circumference, completely surrounding a star with a diameter equal to Earth’s orbit, creating, on the inner surface of the Ring, a living space more than 3 million times the size of Earth! The inspiration for Ian M. Banks’ Orbitals and the famous Ring from Halo, Niven takes the reader on a journey of exploration, conspiracy, mystery and peril along with his four heroes. Louis Wu, a 200-year-old disenchanted professional explorer, Speaker-To-Animals, a diplomat from the feline Warrior-Race of Kzin, Nessus, the cowardly and secretive alien (((Puppeteer))) who’s people both fear and covet the Ringworld, and Teela Brown, a young woman who’s luck may be their salvation…or their doom.

The birth of dozens of staple SF genre conventions and chock-full of intrigue, mystery, and scale, Niven’s story continues to enchant fans of both Hard SF and slow-burn adventure stories with plenty of dry wit. Join us on our Niven deep-dive as we discuss Fate, Luck, and unintentional JQ analogies.

Break Song: Luck of Teela Brown, by The Men From S.P.E.C.T.R.E
item.dc:creator: Magnus Williams

item.title: Pressure Suit Podcast: This Time The MultiVerse: OH JOHN RINGO NO
item.description: In another “quality” episode of This Time The MultiVerse, Magnus and Gordon, against their better judgement, revisit the works of celebrated military SF author and Uber-Boomer John Ringo. What begins as a review of cheesy-but-readable “Humanity, Fuck Yeah!” fiction and early 2000s libertarian talking points takes a turn for the worse, and Gordon and Magnus alternately hold their noses and each other at gunpoint while they descend into Man-Made Horrors Beyond their Comprehension™. Join us for a wild ride of Alien invasions, re-animated SS divisions, a Maple Syrup Billionaire, and possibly the worst action-thriller series ever put to pulp.
item.dc:creator: Magnus Williams

item.title: Pressure Suit Podcast: This Time The Multiverse: Robert E. Howard's Conan
item.description:
This Time The MultiVerse is the first and only Pro-White Speculative Fiction podcast, hosted exclusively on the Amerikaner Network. As the ‘Genre of Ideas’, Speculative Fiction continues to entertain, amaze, and inspire young and old alike, and Pro-White activists are no exception! We review and discuss classic print SF and Fantasy, as well as their impact on the culture and their relevance to the Pro-White movement.


In the inaugural episode of This Time The MultiVerse, Magnus and Gordon take on Robert E. Howard’s Conan, one of the most iconic and seminal figures in pulp fiction and fantasy. Grim and Gregarious, cunning and cruel, stoic and chivalrous, a thief, a reaver, a slayer, soldier, poet and King, he strides across the wild and primitive world of Hyborea, an age after the Fall of Atlantis and just before Herodotus takes up his pen, where all the ancient races of men set their hand to the wheel of civilization against the forces of barbarism and chaos.

Equal parts adventurer, rogue, Hero and mercenary, Conan fights for glory, treasure, and whatever saucy wench Boris Vallejo put on this edition’s cover art (and not in that order!) Brutal, often bestial, but powerful, determined, and resolute, Conan battles barbarian armies, ancient evils, wicked sorcerers and scheming noblemen while upholding his peculiar brand of savage chivalry. Howard’s most popular and beloved character expresses many of Howard’s own dim views on Civilization and the modern ‘soft-living’ degeneracy of the Modern, Multicultural Age. Sometimes, as Howard seems to say, the only way to survive in a Globohomo hellscape is to take up your sword and, in the words of his mighty hero: “Crush your enemies, drive them before you, and hear the lamentations of their women!”
item.dc:creator: Magnus Williams

item.title: Achtung Amerikaner: Midwest News Roundup May 2023
item.description:
Gordon and Grug (with special guest Magnus) are back with more stories from across the Midwest for the month of May. From browns picking blueberries to jews picking on schoolchildren, we've got you covered.

This episode was aired live on Odysee.com/@Amerikaner on June 13th - its audio and replay were made available immediately to subscribers. If you would like to receive this early access, as well as other exclusive content, please visit Amerikaner.org/donate where you will find online payment options - if you prefer the old fashioned way, send all mail to:

PO Box 691
Brookings, SD 57006

We also have stickers!

https://amerikaner.org/stickers/

Achtung! Amerikaner can be found at Amerikaner.org and ExodusAmericanus.com

STORIES COVERED THIS EPISODE

Illinois: https://www.cnn.com/2023/06/12/us/illinois-public-libraries-schools-book-bans/index.html

Indiana: https://www.nhregister.com/news/article/no-legislative-discipline-in-sight-for-indiana-18150351.php

Iowa: https://www.nbcnews.com/nightly-news/video/new-child-labor-laws-in-iowa-draws-mixed-reaction-181807685669

Kansas: https://fox4kc.com/news/video-kansas-city-kansas-police-officer-puts-knee-on-mans-neck-at-walmart/

Michigan: https://www.mlive.com/public-interest/2023/06/west-michigan-blueberry-farm-accused-of-trafficking-workers.html

Minnesota: https://www.parkrapidsenterprise.com/opinion/editorials/immigration-reform-would-help-solve-worker-shortage-in-minnesota-1

Missouri: https://www.nbcnews.com/nbc-out/out-politics-and-policy/kansas-city-declares-lgbtq-sanctuary-city-rcna84126

Nebraska: https://nebraskaexaminer.com/briefs/foes-of-co2-pipelines-mount-billboard-magazine-protest-at-ethanol-conference-in-omaha/

North Dakota: https://www.grandforksherald.com/news/local/north-dakota-museum-of-art-sculpture-missing-seven-months-found-by-dumpster

Ohio: https://www.dispatch.com/story/news/politics/2023/06/13/amended-ohio-parental-rights-bill-expected-to-move-forward-without-opponent-testimony/70315644007/

South Dakota: https://www.dakotanewsnow.com/2023/05/11/sculpture-park-owner-questions-motive-vandals/
https://www.dakotanewsnow.com/2023/05/17/national-lgbtq-group-coming-sd-train-political-candidates/

Wisconsin: https://www.wisn.com/article/i-was-scared-7th-grader-recalls-teacher-threatening-class-after-discovering-swastika-in-notebook/43911414

Honorable Mention
https://apnews.com/article/hot-pocket-kentucky-louisville-shooting-c349b21fcf7f7cba69f8ec9fb121af2d

https://abc7chicago.com/amp/what-is-cocaine-fentanyl-overdose-symptoms/13203054/
https://www.fox6now.com/news/grafton-cocaine-overdose-suspected.amp (Wisconsin)
Fent Laced Coke major problem. Something to watch.

item.title: The Final Storm is Here: TFS 130: Pessimist Prime
item.description: As the team lowers the body of the little mermaid into the ground, we are bombarded with a new wave of brown media that is just as afroturfed as any other product. The brown spidermen movie, and the transformers rise of the brooklyn beasts. While one is a minor W for zog, it is treated as the biggest victory for them since WW2

item.title: The Gamer Word: The Gamer Word Episode 30- Fire Emblem
item.description: In a world where big tiddy goth girls are real, and every action has a consequence, one must seek out truth and wisdom to not only survive, but triumph. Come join Bobby and Fritz as they dole out sage wisdom that will have you excelling at the autistic waifu management/ tactical eugenics needed to defeat the dragon of death!

item.title: The Godcast: The Godcast, Episode 251: The Radicals
item.description:
In this episode, SuperLutheran and Myles take a look at the 1989 film The Radicals, which gives a brief and dramatized history of the Anabaptist movement in Europe. We also tackle your emails after the break.

Are Jews the chosen people of God? No: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pzHB5Caglgo

Age of Ruin: From the Ashes: https://poa.st/@Godcast/posts/ALVRT05jJfK3me3PtY

The first of what I hope to be many entries in a science fiction universe both by and for /ourguys/.

Things we talked about during the show:

The Radicals: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0189038/

If you have questions about the Christian faith or just want to get in touch with us, we can be reached at TheGodcast@Protonmail.com

If you’d like to support the Godcast and/or The Very Lutheran Project, you can do so here: https://verylutheran.gumroad.com/

Myles and Super can be found improving timelines on the Fediverse here:

poa.st/@Godcast

poa.st/@SuperLutheran

Pugnus Pastorem

item.title: Amerikaner Community Radio: Resurrection
Achtung Amerikaner: The Internet Is Not Your Friend
item.description:
In this very special episode of Achtung! Amerikaner, Gordon and Grug have a chat with Rick of The Smoke Pit and Bobby of The Gamer Word to discuss Rick's recent muzzling on Telegram, and to give some general OpSec and InfoSec advice on how to avoid common scams and tricks from our enemies. Remember - if you don't own it, it isn't yours. Act accordingly.

IMPORTANT NOTE (Thank you to A on Telegram):

Alright boys there was misinfo put out on the last Achtung Amerikaner episode (7 June)

Time 7:33 Grug says that the @username of bad actors is exactly the same as legitimate accounts. This can not be true. There is an easy way to check against this.

Copy the legit @username and paste it into an ASCII converter and do the same with the suspect @username . The values will be different as two accounts can not exist on one handle

http://asciivalue.com/

The Cyrillic keyboard has many characters that appear identical to our alphabet but have a different ASCII value.
a а
e е
K К
B В
C С
o о
Et cetera.. These are all unique characters

https://amerikaner.org/opsec-tips-for-non-techies/

The livestream is free to view - the replay and audio will be made available early to paid subscribers. Visit Amerikaner.org/donate for online payment options - you can also send mail correspondence to:

PO Box 691
Brookings, SD 57006

BUY SOME STICKERS!
https://amerikaner.org/stickers/

Achtung! Amerikaner can be found on Amerikaner.org and ExodusAmericanus.com

item.title: Exodus Americanus: Exo 363
Pressure Suit Podcast: Heinlein's Juvenile's - Have Space Suit - Will Travel and Red Planet
item.description: Gordon and Magnus open the inaugural episode of the Pressure Suit Podcast by discussing 2 of Heinlein's classic Juvenile novels, Have Space Suit - Will Travel and Red Planet. Charming, lighthearted, and packed with vitamins, these 2 short novels will be sure to satisfy anyone looking for a comfy Golden Age sci-fi adventure.
item.dc:creator: Magnus Williams

item.title: The Gamer Word: The Gamer Word Episode 29- Cooperative Lolcows
item.description: The men come together to discuss fun (and potentially "free") games to play together with their fellow Gamers, while driving Ruckus further into depression with the reminder that Lolcows exist, and discussing the sick society and "people" that enable such depravity in our world.
